titleStmt.title: E. Ragland to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1775

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Blandville Ky. Feb. 8th 1864
To his Excellency Thos. E. Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky --
I respectfully tender to you, my, resignation of the office of Justice of the peace for District No 1. Ballard County Kentucky.
I respectfully recommend John M. Ogden as a suitable and competant man for said office
The undersigned citizens of Destrict No 1 in Ballard County ask your Excellency to commission Jno. M. Ogden a Justice of the Peace to fill the vacancy occassioned by the resignation of E. Ragland --

A M Shelly
Wm Bradshaw
M H Jearell

Ballard Co
Jus Peace
Resignation
&
Appointment
13th Feby 1864
